description:
Running Folsom 2012.2.3 Multi-host mode.
The quotas are set equal to one tiny host and a couple Gb for one volume. We have a very high user base for the amount of hardware we have.

User's launch through the dashboard only.

This quota works for a few launches/terminations of a vm, then I start to get the error:
Error: Quota exceeded for cores,instances,ram: Requested 1, but already used 1 of 1 cores (HTTP 413) (Request-ID: req-32e06807-7fba-4e2f-8536-4f68f1483176)

I did test at the cli for debug sake and I get the same error.

[root@host2 ~]# nova boot --flavor 1 --image 9e74dc60-879d-4b4c-be45-7d721e63a821 test
ERROR: Quota exceeded for cores,instances,ram: Requested 1, but already used 1 of 1 cores (HTTP 413) (Request-ID: req-a90b1d98-ed16-4bb8-9244-5525c4ee7b65)

At the point I get this error there are no resources used in this project, quota summary on the overview page is empty

I resolved this one time by cleaning out the reservations and quota_usage tables in the db manually. Then it happened again.
title: quotas restrict launch but no instances running

comments.content:
Running Folsom 2012.2.3 Multi-host mode.
The quotas are set equal to one tiny host and a couple Gb for one volume. We have a very high user base for the amount of hardware we have.

User's launch through the dashboard only.

This quota works for a few launches/terminations of a vm, then I start to get the error:
Error: Quota exceeded for cores,instances,ram: Requested 1, but already used 1 of 1 cores (HTTP 413) (Request-ID: req-32e06807-7fba-4e2f-8536-4f68f1483176)

I did test at the cli for debug sake and I get the same error.

[root@host2 ~]# nova boot --flavor 1 --image 9e74dc60-879d-4b4c-be45-7d721e63a821 test
ERROR: Quota exceeded for cores,instances,ram: Requested 1, but already used 1 of 1 cores (HTTP 413) (Request-ID: req-a90b1d98-ed16-4bb8-9244-5525c4ee7b65)

At the point I get this error there are no resources used in this project, quota summary on the overview page is empty

I resolved this one time by cleaning out the reservations and quota_usage tables in the db manually. Then it happened again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dradez

comments.content: Can you tell us the reproduce steps? otherwise we can't fix this issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hzwangpan

comments.content:
I'm actually not sure how to reproduce is other than setting the quotas equal to the tiny instance and firing off some machines.

Though it looks like this bug is the same thing https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1009115

I haven't been able to find the patch that was merged for this, but it also looks like it's pending being backported to folsom.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dradez

comments.content: Can you try to reproduce this with grizzly or the latest code in master?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
I have started to see this issue in Icehouse again.
A user has no instances running and their quota usage is at one instance.

I'm still not sure how to reproduce this. The admin account in TryStack has this issue, one more instance reported in quotas than what is running.

Is there something I could do with this account to help debug it?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dradez

comments.content: This bug is fairly old and doesn't explain how to reproduce it. Marking as invalid. If we find out how to reproduce this error lets just open a new bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo
